episodes.title: From Escaping a Cult to Making Millions
episodes.description:
Breaking free from a controlled world is one thing. Rebuilding a life without education, resources, or a safety net is something far more extraordinary.

In this episode, Michelle Coyle meets with Ken Okazaki who shares how growing up in a cult shaped every belief he had and why questioning those beliefs became the first act of freedom. Leaving the group meant stepping into adulthood with zero preparation. His first break came from learning media inside his father’s seminar company, which opened the door to events, storytelling, and high‑stakes production at a scale he never imagined.

Ken also reveals the devastating event failure that nearly ruined him—and the decision to pay back every customer over two years instead of walking away. That commitment became the foundation of his reputation and the launchpad for the global content agency he runs today.

Ready to rethink what’s possible? Tune in to this episode of From Escaping a Cult to Making Millions.

Key Points:
00:00 Introduction  
01:00 Ken’s childhood and upbringing
03:45 Learning truth online
04:45 The travel mission that started the change
07:29 Marriage, parenting, rising doubts
10:00 Decision to leave
12:20 Breaking mental conditioning
14:45 Navigating the outside world
18:47 Business ventures that influenced Ken
21:17 Partnership and first big event challenge
24:25 Creative problem‑solving moments
26:47 Debt repayment and progress
28:58 Pivot to video content
30:35 Launching 52 in 2 initiative
33:24 Transforming systems into webinars
35:30 Fear and impostor feelings
39:10 Consistency and confidence
40:50 Inner drive vs. outside validation
42:18 AI, tech, and authentic creation
43:39 Where to connect online

Michelle Coyle is a business expert, investor, and transformational trainer with over 20 years of entrepreneurial experience. She believes you don’t have to choose between success and well-being because you can have both. With a mix of honesty, humor, and heart, Michelle guides leaders to step into who they really are and grow from that place. She’s the founder of BGSD Strategies and the Political Business Institute, where she supports people who want to make a real difference without losing themselves in the process. Michelle holds an MBA from Dartmouth and is trained in tools like NLP, Hypnosis, and Emotional Release to help others break free from what’s holding them back and create the life they know they’re meant for.

Connect with Michelle Coyle:
Website: https://michellecoyle.com/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/michelletoscale/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/michelletoscale/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michellelaree 

Ken Okazaki is the CEO of Oz Media Global and a leading expert in video marketing, helping creators and businesses turn content into profit. He and his team produce high-converting video content across YouTube, podcasts, and social media, serving clients in more than 15 countries. Ken is also the inventor, CEO of GoBox Studio, the world’s most portable content creation studio, and host of The Content Capitalists Podcast, where he interviews entrepreneurs making seven figures through content. Based in Japan, he’s built a global brand by combining strategy, storytelling, and systems that scale.
